remarks: A sum in an opposite monoid is the regular sum of a reversed word. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 27-Aug-2015.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2016.)
statement:
gsumwrev.b $e |- B = ( Base ` M ) $.
gsumwrev.o $e |- O = ( oppG ` M ) $.
gsumwrev $p |- ( ( M e. Mnd /\ W e. Word B ) -> ( O gsum W ) = ( M gsum ( reverse ` W ) ) ) $.
